message.content:
cs.IR, cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.IT. 

The paper is about developing a new information retrieval model based on a proposed theory called Least Information theory (LIT). Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.IR (Information Retrieval). The paper also discusses the quantification of meaning of information in probability distribution changes, which relates to natural language processing and computational linguistics, making cs.CL (Computation and Language) another likely sub-category. The paper also proposes new quantities for term weighting and document ranking, which involves machine learning and statistical modeling, making cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) likely sub-categories. Finally, the paper discusses the measurement of semantic quantities of information, which relates to information theory and coding theory, making cs.IT (Information Theory) a possible sub-category as well.
